items.title: Brace for a cold and windy 2026, follow the dharma of asset allocation: Nilesh Shah
items.description: CY25 saw precious metals surge while equities showed resilience and fixed income lagged. CY26 anticipates a volatile Test match for equities with moderate gains expected, driven by earnings growth and domestic buying. Gold and silver retain their positive outlook, while fixed income requires agile duration management. Investors should prioritize asset allocation, patience, and quality for long-term rewards.

items.title: Why did Indian equities underperform global markets in 2025?
items.description: Indian stock markets ended 2025 with modest single-digit gains, significantly trailing global peers like Korea and Brazil. While public sector banks and metals shone with impressive returns, consumer and technology stocks faced considerable selling pressure. This performance highlights a divergence in market trends, with specific sectors outperforming others.

items.title: Stock Market Outlook 2026: Why blue-chip stocks are preferred equity bet for investors?
items.description: Money managers favor blue-chip stocks for 2026, anticipating foreign investor interest and better valuation comfort. While Nifty gained 10.5% in 2025, mid and small caps lagged. Experts predict Nifty and Sensex gains of 8-14% in 2026, with large caps expected to lead initially.

items.title: Vodafone Idea shares in focus as Vodafone Group commits Rs 5,836 crore support
items.description: Vodafone Idea shares will be in focus on January 1, 2026. The company will receive Rs 5,836 crore from its promoter group, Vodafone Group. This follows an amendment to an agreement concerning contingent liabilities. Vodafone Group Promoters will release Rs 2,307 crore over the next year. The remaining amount will be secured through a share-based mechanism.

items.title: Positive Breakout: These 11 stocks cross above their 200 DMAs
items.description: As of December 31, 2025, 16 stocks in the Nifty 500 segment closed above their 200-day moving average (DMA). Of these, we have highlighted the top 11 stocks that posted gains of more than 1.5%, based on StockEdge’s technical scan data. The 200-day daily moving average (DMA) is used as a key indicator by traders for determining the overall trend in a particular stock. As long as the stock is priced above the 200-day SMA on the daily time frame, it is generally considered to be an overall uptrend. Take a look:

items.title: Stocks to buy for 2026: Shriram Finance, Engineers India among 5 stocks that could give 20-40% return in 1 year
items.description: Brokerage houses continue to flag stock-specific opportunities across financials, engineering, infrastructure, and retail, backed by improving earnings visibility and strong execution trends.We have collated a list of recommendations from top brokerage firms from ETNow and other sources:

items.title: MCX shares approach record date for first-ever 5:1 stock split tomorrow. What it means for the shareholders?
items.description: Investors looking to benefit from Multi Commodity Exchange's (MCX) first-ever 5:1 stock split must purchase shares by January 1, 2026. The split, effective January 2, 2026, will increase the number of shares held by shareholders fivefold while maintaining their total investment value. This corporate action aims to enhance stock liquidity and accessibility.

items.title: New Year Stock Market Holiday for 2026: Are NSE, BSE closed today on 1 January; Check here
items.description: NSE Holidays for New Year 2026: Domestic bourses NSE and BSE will remain open for trading on January 1, even as most of its major global peers will remain closed. Commodity exchanges MCX and NCDEX will be open during the day session but will remain closed in the evening session.

items.title: GIFT Nifty up 60 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
items.description: Indian equity markets concluded 2025 with a 10% gain in the Nifty, signaling a year of gradual recovery. Analysts anticipate steady growth in 2026, driven by improving corporate earnings, a revival in private investment, and supportive government policies. The Nifty remains in a sideways trend, with key support and resistance levels identified.

items.title: Stocks in news: Vodafone Idea, Hyundai India, RBL Bank, Adani Green, IndiGo
items.description: Markets closed the year positively, with analysts favoring banking, auto, and metal stocks. Vodafone Idea will receive Rs 5,836 crore from its promoter. IndiGo anticipates carrying 10 million more passengers this year, while Hyundai India announced price hikes from January 1, 2026. Adani Green operationalized 307.4 MW power projects, and RBL Bank applied to cap foreign shareholding.

items.title: Fund managers urge diversification amid AI and valuation concerns
items.description: Indian equity investors look forward to a calmer 2026. The Nifty is expected to gain between 8-14 percent. This optimism stems from anticipated corporate earnings growth in the second half of the year. Foreign fund flows are also expected to revive. A trade deal with the US is also a key factor.

items.title: High-conviction bets for 2026 with potential gains of 11–39%
items.description: Indian equities face an uncertain start to 2026 after a volatile 2025. While a recovery is expected, lingering trade deal doubts and a lack of new catalysts suggest a stock picker's market. Leading brokerages highlight high-conviction ideas with potential upside between 11.3% and 39%.

items.title: 7 risks that could derail Nifty’s 2026 rally before it reaches 29,000
items.description: Despite Nifty's decade-long winning streak, 2026 targets of 29,000 face significant hurdles. Experts warn of potential derailment from a delayed US-India trade deal, global geopolitical chaos, and an AI bubble burst. Earnings-valuation mismatches, crude oil spikes, rupee depreciation, and an equity supply glut also pose substantial risks to the rally.

items.title: Hyundai India shares in focus after a minor price hike announcement
items.description: Hyundai Motor India announced a marginal vehicle price hike from January 2026 to offset rising input costs. While near-term technical indicators show mild pressure, strong long-term trends, stable valuations, and rising foreign investor interest continue to support the stock’s broader growth outlook.

items.title: Reliance Industries, JSW Steel among 7 stocks showing bullish RSI upswings
items.description: On December 31, seven Nifty50 stocks that gained over 1.5% were highlighted in the RSI Trending Up scan, based on data from StockEdge.com. An uptrend signal is generated when the RSI crosses above 50 from below. “RSI trending up” indicates rising Relative Strength Index values, suggesting strengthening price momentum. This may signal potential upside and is often used by traders to identify buying opportunities.

items.title: IndiGo shares in focus as airline charts global expansion in 2026
items.description: IndiGo closed 2025 with strong passenger growth, expanded domestic and international networks, new long-haul routes, and major aircraft orders. With A321XLR induction, wider global alliances, and improved connectivity, the airline enters 2026 positioned for sustained international expansion and operational scale.

items.title: IREDA shares in focus on Q3 business update; loan sanctions, disbursements surge
items.description: IREDA shares are poised for attention following a robust business update for the December quarter. The state-run lender reported significant year-on-year growth in loan sanctions, disbursements, and its outstanding loan book. This follows a strong September quarter performance, which saw a substantial increase in net profit and revenue.

items.title: LIC’s 2025 scorecard: 64% stocks end in red, but 77 beat Nifty including 2 multibaggers. Do you own any?
items.description: LIC's 2025 investment performance revealed a stark divide. A significant majority of its portfolio stocks ended the year in the red, with many experiencing substantial declines. However, a notable portion of its holdings also delivered impressive gains. This mixed performance highlights the volatility experienced by India's largest institutional investor during the year.

items.title: Silver prices gain 1% at Rs 2.37 lakh on Jan 1, gold opens flat. What should investors do in 2026?
items.description: Gold and silver began 2026 on a mixed note, with gold trading flat while silver extended its strong rally. Gold February futures inched up 0.06% on MCX, whereas silver March futures rose 0.86%, continuing last year’s sharp surge driven by tight supply, strong demand and supportive interest rates.

items.title: ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares crack up to 8% on New Year’s Day. What’s the bad news?
items.description: Tobacco stocks like ITC and Godfrey Phillips saw significant drops on Thursday. This follows the finance ministry's notification of an additional excise duty on tobacco products. The new levies, effective February 1, will be applied over and above the GST rate. This change replaces the existing compensation cess. Companies may need to increase prices due to these higher taxes.

items.title: Sensex kicks off 2026 with 200-point jump, Nifty above 26,150; auto, bank stocks rally
items.description: Indian stock markets, Nifty and Sensex, started 2026 with gains for a second day. Auto, bank, and IT stocks saw significant increases. However, major FMCG companies experienced sharp drops, limiting the overall market rise. The Sensex opened higher by 220 points, and the Nifty 50 also climbed. This marks a positive start to the trading year.

items.title: Vodafone Idea shares jump 10% as Rs 5,836 crore group settlement lifts survival hopes
items.description: Vodafone Idea shares jumped nearly 10% after regulatory filings showed the telecom operator will receive Rs 5,836 crore from Vodafone Group under a revised liability settlement, while separate reports pointed to fresh government relief on its adjusted gross revenue dues, together offering a rare boost to the debt-laden telco.

items.title: Cupid shares extend rally for 15th consecutive session, jump 34% in just 15 Days
items.description: Cupid Ltd's shares have surged 34% in 15 sessions, hitting a new all-time high. The FMCG player announced plans for its first overseas manufacturing facility in Saudi Arabia, aiming to boost global expansion. Promoter confidence has also strengthened with a significant reduction in pledged shares.

items.title: Adani Power shares jump 7%, brokerages see multi-year earnings upcycle. Should you buy or sell?
items.description: Adani Power shares rose as much as 7% on Thursday, with brokerages highlighting a long runway for earnings growth driven by a sharp expansion in capacity, rising long-term power purchase agreements and improving cash-flow visibility as India’s baseload power demand strengthens.

items.title: 2026 may not be for cement stocks but long term growth intact. What are analysts saying?
items.description: After a weak 2025, India’s cement sector enters 2026 facing capacity pressure and pricing challenges, even as long term infrastructure driven demand remains intact.

items.title: Shriram Finance shares hit record high, cross Rs 1,000 for first time. Too late to buy?
items.description: Shriram Finance shares hit a record high as analysts upgraded target prices following MUFG’s landmark investment and a credit rating upgrade, boosting confidence in the company’s capital strength and growth outlook.

items.title: Defence stock that’s up 2,100% in 5 years bags second order in two days; shares jump 3%
items.description: Apollo Micro Systems shares jumped after its subsidiary won a fresh ₹150 crore order from a private player, marking the second major contract in two days. Earlier, the company had secured orders worth over ₹420 crore, including a ₹419.39 crore contract from Coal India subsidiaries, boosting investor sentiment.

items.title: What cigarette tax hike means for 37 lakh ITC shareholders? Jefferies explains
items.description: Jefferies warned that the sharp hike in cigarette excise duty is clearly negative for ITC in the near term, likely hurting volumes and earnings. The brokerage called the move a major negative surprise for the legal cigarette industry, estimating over a 20% rise in effective tax incidence, and said it increases policy uncertainty despite its continued positive stance on ITC.

items.title: Rs 50,000 crore wiped out as ITC shares crack 10%, worst day in 6 years. Should investors buy the fear?
items.description: ITC shares fell sharply on Thursday, erasing over Rs 50,000 crore in market value after a steep new cigarette tax spooked investors. The excise hike—on top of GST—may force price increases of 15% or more, raising risks of volume loss and a shift toward illicit trade, analysts warned.

items.title: Dividend yield shake-up: Vedanta drops to 7th, smallcap surprise for top slot. Check top 10 stocks
items.description: Vedanta has slipped to seventh place in India’s dividend yield rankings, with smallcap Multibase India taking the top spot at a staggering 24.8%, followed by Allcargo Logistics and Premco Global. SBI Securities’ latest review highlights a major shake-up driven by sharp price moves and shifting payout trends across companies.
